titleStmt.title: (A key to the colourization may be found at: http://oracc.museum.upenn.edu/doc/user/teicolours.html.)X102770 = AD -277ABC

w.lemma: emēdu[lean on//be at a stationary point]V
emēdu[lean on//be at a stationary point]V
na[time interval between the rising of a planet and sunrise viz. sunset and the setting of a planet//rising to sunrise]N
emēdu[lean on//be at a stationary point]V
qablītu[middle watch (of the night)//middle watch (of the night)]N
na[time interval between the rising of a planet and sunrise viz. sunset and the setting of a planet//sunset to setting]N

p.span: [Month I, ... the moon was] 1 cubit [...] η Tauri; Jupiter was 2 1/2 cubits below η Tauri. The 1st, equinox. Night [of the 2nd, the moon was] 2 2/3 cubits above α Tauri. Night of the 3rd, the moon was 1/3 cubit above ζ Tauri.

[The 4th?, Mercury’s] first appearance [in the east,] omitted. Night of the 5th, clouds crossed the sky. Night of the 9th, beginning of the night, the moon was 2 [cubits] behind ρ Leonis. Night of the 10th, beginning of the night, the moon was 4 cubits below ϑ Leonis,

the moon having passed 2/3 cubit to the east. Night of the 11th, beginning of the night, the moon was 2 1/2 cubits behind β Virginis. Night of the 12th, beginning of the night, [the moon was] 1 cubit [behind] γ Virginis. Night of the 13th, beginning of the night,

[the moon was] 2 cubits [behind] α Virginis. Night of the 14th, moonrise to sunset: 12°; beginning of the night, the moon was ... cubits in [front of α Librae.] The 14th, [moonset to sunrise:] 6° 30+[x]'; [...] Night of the 15th, sunset to moonrise: 50'; clouds, I did not watch. The 15th, [sunrise to moonset:] 5° 30+[x]'.
[... The 16th,] clouds crossed the sky. The 21st, Jupiter’s last appearance in Taurus [...] 4 cubits [..., the m]oon was 2 cubits behind δ Capricorni. Night of the 23rd, first part of the night,
[Mars] was 2/3 cubit above α Leonis. Night of the 25th, last part of the night, the moon was [...] be[hind Venus ... The 2]7th, panic and fear occurred in the land.
That month, the equivalent of 1 shekel of silver was: barley, 1 kur 3 sūtu; dates, 2 pānu 4 sūtu 3 qa; [...]

At that time, Jupiter which had set was not visible; Venus was in Pisces; Mercury, which had set, was not visible; Saturn was in [Capricorn; Mars was in Leo ...] the high [water] came; 1 was the na (gauge).

[Mon]th II, (the 1st of which was identical with) the 30th (of the preceding month), sunset to moonset: 19°; the moon was [...] in front of β Tauri. [Night of the 2nd,] the moon was [...] in front of η Gemin[orum. Night of the 3rd, the moon was ... in front of α Geminorum. Ni]ght of the 4th, the moon was 1 1/2 cubits behind β Geminorum.
Night of the 5th, clouds crossed the sky. Night of the 6th, [...] night, thunder, lightning fla[shed ...] ... Night of the 7th, beginning of the night,
the moon was 2 1/2 cubits below α Leonis, the moon having passed 2/3 cubit to the east; the moon [was surrounded] by a halo, α Leonis [stood] in it. [... the moon was] 4 cubits below ϑ Leonis,
[the moon] being 3 cubits back to the west. Night of the 9th, beginning of the night, the moon was 2 1/2 cubits below β Virginis? [...] Night of the 10th, beginning of the night, the moon was
2 cubits below γ Virginis; the 10th, last part of the night, Venus was 10+[x ...] below η Piscium [... when Saturn became stationary to the east,] it became stationary [...] behind β Capricorni.
[...] Night of the 11th, beginning of the night, [the moon?]
Night of the 13th, beginning of the night, the moon was 2 1/2 cubits below α Librae, the moon being 2/3 cubit [... Night of the 14th, the moon ... Scorpii x]+1/2 cubit.

[The 14th,] moonset to sunrise: 7° 40'. Night of the 15th, moonrise to sunset: 6°, measured; beginning of the night, the moon was [... behind? α Scorpii ..., mea]sured. {The 15th,} fir[st part of the night, Venus was]
4 cubits [below] β Arietis; in the morning, clouds ... [... The 19th?, Siriu]s’ last appearance. Ni[ght of the 18th,]
[last part of the night,] the moon was 2 1/2 cubits in front of β Capricorni, [it stood] 3 cubits in front of Saturn to the west [...] ... [Night of the 25th,]
[last part of the night,] the moon was 6 cubits below α Arietis. Night [...]
[The 27th,] moonrise to sunrise: 18° 50'. The 28th, Jupiter’s first appearance in Taurus; [rising of Jupiter to sunrise:] 11+[x ...]
[...] That month, the equivalent [of 1 shekel of silver was]: barley, 1 kur 3 sūtu; dates, 2 pānu 2 sūtu [...]
[At that] time, Jupiter was in Taurus; Venus was in Aries; Mer[cury ...]

[Month III, the 1st (of which followed the 30th of the preceding month),] sunset to moonset: [2]5°; (it could be seen while) the sun (stood there); the moon was in front of β Geminorum [... x]+1 cubit [...]
[...] 1 cubit. Night of the 5th, the moon was [...] be[low ϑ Leonis ... Night of the 6th, beginning of the night, the moon was] 2 2/3 cubits [below] β Virginis. [Night of the 7th,]
[beginning of the night, the m]oon was 2 1/2 [cubits] in front of γ Virginis. [Night of the 8th, beginning of the night, the moon was] 2+[x cubits in front of α] Virginis.
[Night of the 10th, beginning of the night, the moon was ...] behind [α] Librae [... Night of the 12th, beginning of the ni]ght, the moon was 1+[x ...] above α Scorpii [...]
[... The 15th,] sunrise to moonset: [x]+1° 30'. Night of the 1[6th, ...]
[... first] part of the night, Mars was [...] below β Virginis [...]
[... Night of the 22nd, last part of the night, the m]oon was 1+[x ...] below β Arietis [...]
[... Night of the 25th, last part of the ni]ght, the moon was 4 cubits above α Tauri; last part of the night, the moon was above [Jupiter? ...]
[... last part of the ni]ght, Venus was 3 cubits below β Tauri. That month, the equivalent for 1 shekel of silver was: bar[ley, ...]
[...] At that time, Jupiter and Venus were in Taurus; Mercury was in Cancer; Sat[urn was in Capricorn; Mars was in Leo, at the end of the month, in Virgo.]

[Month IV, (the 1st of which was identical with) the 30th (of the preceding month), ...] 5? fingers. The 3rd, solstice. The 6th, Saturn’s acronychal rising. Night of the 7th, beginning of the night, [...]
[... Night of the 8th, beginning of the night, the moon was] 2 1/2 cubits [in front of α Libr]ae. Night of the 9th, last part of the night, Venus was [nn fingers] below η Geminorum.
[... Night of the 1]1th, beginning of the night, the moon was 1 cubit in front of ϑ Ophiuchi; last part of the night, Venus was [...] below μ Gemin[orum].
[... Night of the 14th, beginning of the night, the moon was] 1 1/2 cubits above Saturn, the moon being 2/3 cubit back to the west; last part of the night, Venus was [...] above γ Ge[minorum.]
[... Night of the 15th, last part of the night, the moon was] 2 1/2 cubits [in front of] γ Capricorni. The 15th, sunrise to moonset: 12°. Night of the 16th, sunset to moonrise: 11° [...]
[... last part of the night, Venus was] 5 cubits [below] α Geminorum. Night of the 21st, last part of the night, Jupiter was [...] below β Tauri.
[... Night of the 22nd, last part of the night, the moon was] 1/2 cubit [...] η Tauri. Night of the 23rd, last part of the night, the moon was [...] above α Tauri.
[... Night of the 24th, last part of the night, ..., Venus was] 3 1/2 cubits below β Geminorum. Night of the 25th, last part of the night, [...]
[... Night of the 26th, last part of the night, the moon was] 2 1/2 cubits in front of Venus. The 27th, moonrise to sunrise: 18°. The 28th, [...]
[...] mustard, [...;] cress, 2 pānu; sesame, 2 sūtu 3 qa; wool, [...]
[... Ve]nus was in Gemini, at the end of the month, in Cancer; Mercury, which had set, was not visible; Saturn was in [Capricorn; Mars was in Virgo.]
[Month V, the 1st (of which followed the 30th of the preceding month), ...] Night of the 4th, the moon was 1/2 cubit behind α Virginis. Night of the 6th, beginning of the night, the moon was [...]
[in front? of β Librae ... Night] of the 7th, beginning of the night, the moon was 1 cubit in front of δ Scorpii. The 7th, Mercury’s [first appearance] in the east [in Cancer]
[...] Night of the 9th, beginning of the night, the moon was 1 1/2 cubits behind ϑ Ophiuchi. Night of the 12th, beginning of the night, the moon was [...] behind β [Capricorni]

[... Night of the 13th, beginning of the night, the moon was] 1 2/3 cubits [...] γ Capricorni. The 13th, moonset to sunrise: 12°. Night of the 14th, moonrise to sunset: 12°, measured. The 14th, sunrise to moonset: 5° 20'. Ni[ght of the 15th, sunset to moonrise: ...]
[... Night] of the 16th, last part of the night, Jupiter was 2/3 cubits above ζ Tauri. Night of the 17th, last part of the night, the moon was [...] in front of η Piscium.

[... Night of the 18th, last part of the night, the moon was] 1 cubit [behind α A]rietis. Night of the 19th, last part of the night, the moon was 2 cubits in front of η Tauri. Night of the 20th, last part of the [night, the moon was]
[... Night of the 21st, last part of the night, the moo]n was 2/3 cubit in front of Jupiter, 1/2 cubit in front of ζ Tauri. Night of the 22nd, last part of the night, the moon was behind [...]
[... Venus was] 4 fingers above α Leonis. The 27th, moonrise to sunrise: 17°. The 28th, Mercury’s [last appearance] in the east in Leo [...]
[...] pānu; cress, 1 pānu 4 sūtu; sesame, 4 sūtu; wool, 3 mi[nas.]
[At that time, Jupiter was in] Gemini; Venus was in Leo; Mercury, which had set, was not visible; Saturn was in Capricorn; [Mars was in Libra.]

[Month VI, the 1st (of which followed the 30th of the preceding month), ... last part of the night, Venus was ... above] ρ Leonis. [Night] of the 3rd, the moon was 2 1/2 cubits below α Librae, 1 1/2 cubits below Mars [...]

[...] Night of the 5th, the moon was 2/3 cubit in front of α Scorpii. [Night] of the 6th, beginn[ing of the night, the m]oon was 8 fingers above ϑ Ophiuchi; first part of the night, Mars was [...] below α Librae.

[Night of the 9th, beginning of the night, the moon was] 2/3 cubit [above?] Saturn, 1 2/3 cubits in front of β Capricorni. Night of the 10th, beg[inning of the night, the moon was] 3 1/2 cubits in front of γ Capricorni. Night of the 11th, beginning of the night, [the moon was]

[nn] cubits [behind δ Capricorni.] Night of the 13th, first part of the night, Mars was 4 1/2 cubits below β Librae; [last part of the night, Venus was] 4 1/2 cubits below ϑ Leonis. The 13th, moonset to sunrise: 1° 50'. Night [of the 14th,]

[moonrise to sunset: nn, (measured).] The 14th, sunrise to moonset: 16°, measured. Night of the 15th, sunset to moonrise: 7° 30'; last part of the night, the moon was 1 1/2 cubits below [β] Arietis. Night of the 17th, last part of the night, the moon was [...] behind η Tauri.

Night of the 18th, last part of the night, the moon was 2 1/2 cubits in front of β Tauri. Night of the 19th, last part of the night, the moon was [nn] cubits in front of η [Geminorum.] Night of the 20th, last part of the night, the moon was 3 cubits in front of α Geminorum.

The 20th, Jupiter became stationary in Gemini. Night of the 23rd, last part of the night, the moon was 4 cubits below ε Leonis. Night of the 2[4th, ...] Night of the 25th, last part of the night, the moon was 6 cubits below ϑ Leonis.

Night of the 26th, last part of the night, the moon was 2 cubits behind β Virginis. The 27th, moonrise to sunrise: 13° 10'. [That month, the equivalent] for 1 shekel of silver was: [barley, ...] 2 sūtu; dates, 3 pānu 2 sūtu; mustard, 1 kur; cress, 1 pānu 4 sūtu;

sesame, 5 sūtu; wool, 3 minas. At that time, Jupiter was in Gemini; [Venus was in Virgo?; Mercury, which had set, was not visible; Sat]urn was in Capricorn; Mars was in Libra, at the end of the month in Scorpius.

Month VII, the 1st (of which followed the 30th of the preceding month), sunset to moonset: 15°; first part of the night, Mars was 1/2 cubit above δ Scorpii. Night of the 2nd, the moon was 1+[x] cubits behind δ Scorpii, 2/3 cubit behind Mars.

Night of the 3rd, the moon was 2 cubits in front of ϑ Ophiuchi. Night of the 6th, beginning of the night, the moon was 2 cubits in front of Saturn. The 6th, equinox. Night [of the 7th, beginning of the night, the moon was] 2 cubits behind β Capricorni.
Night of the 8th, beginning of the night, the moon was 1 2/3 cubits above δ Capricorni. Night of the 12th, beginning of the night, the moon was 1 cubit ... [...]
[...] Night of the 11th, first part of the night, Mars was 2 1/2 cubits above α Scorpii. Night of the 12th, first part of the night, the moon was ... in front of η Piscium.

The 12th, moonset to sunrise: 8°. Night of the 13th, moonrise to sunset: 7° 20'; beginning of the night, the moon was 2 cubits below α Arietis. The 13th, sunrise to moonset: 9°. Night of the 14th, sunset to moonrise: 5°, measured; last part of the night,

the moon was 1 cubit behind η Tauri. Night of the 15th, last part of the night, the moon was 1 cubit behind α Tauri. Night of the 16th, last part of the night, the moon was 2/3 cubit behind ζ Tauri. Night of the 17th, last part of the night, the moon was
[...] Night of the 16th, last part of the night, the moon was 2/3 cubit behind ζ Tauri; last part of the night, Jupiter entered the moon. Night of the 17th, last part of the night, the moon was

1 cubit behind γ Geminorum. Night of the 18th, last part of the night, the moon was 3 cubits below β Geminorum. Night of the 1[9th, last part of the night, the moon was 2/3 cubit below ϑ Cancri.] The 20th, Mercury’s

first appearance in the west, omitted. Night of the 21st, last part of the night, the moon was 1 1/2 cubits below α Leonis. (From ex.C: Night of the 22nd, last part of the night, the moon was 2 cubits in front of ϑ Leonis.) Night of the 23rd, last part of the night, the moon was 1 1/2 cubits in front of β Virginis. [Night of the 24th, last part of the night,] the moon was
2 1/2 cubits in front of γ Virginis. The 24th, Venus’ last appearance in the east in the end of Libra. Night of the 25th, [...] 8 fingers; last part of the night, the moon was

2 cubits in front of α Virginis. The 27th, moonrise to sunrise: 21° 40'; clouds, I did not watch. That month, the equivalent for 1 shekel of silver was: barley, 1 kur 2 pānu 3 sūtu; dates, 3 pānu; mustard, 1 kur 2 pānu 3 sūtu; cress, 2 pānu (var. 1 pānu 4 sūtu); sesame, 1 pānu;

wool, 3 minas. At that time, Jupiter was in Gemini; Venus’ last appearance on the 24th in Libra; Mercury, which had set, was not visible; Saturn was in Capricorn; Mars was in Scorpius. That month, the river level receded 1/2 cubit; 30 was the na (gauge).
[...] 23 was the na (gauge).
Month VIII, (the 1st of which was identical with) the 30th (of the preceding month, sunset to moonset): 12° 30'.
Diary from month I to the end of month VII, year 34, kings [Antiochus and S]eleucus.

[Month VIII, ... Night of the 2nd, the moon was] 4 fingers [...] Mars. Night of the 5th, the moon was 1 cubit behind Saturn, [...] behind β Capricorni. Night of the 6th, the moon was 1 1/2 cubits in front of γ Capricorni, the moon being 2 2/3 cubits above Capricorn.

[...] Night of the 7th, beginning of the night, the moon was 3 1/2 cubits behind δ Capricorni. Night of the 8th, last part of the night, Jupiter was 1/2 cubit ... ζ Tauri. The 8th, very overcast. Night of the 10th, beginning of the night, the moon was
[...] cubits. Night of the 11th, beginning of the night, the moon was 1 2/3 cubits in front of β Arietis. Night of the 1[2th, ...] 4 cubits [...] α Arietis.

[... the sun] rose in a black "box". Night of the 13th, moonrise to sunset: 11°, measured; beginning of the night, the moon was 1 cubit in front of η Tauri. [...] lunar [eclipse], ... omitted. The 13th, ...

[... Night of the 14th,] last part of the night, the moon was 1 1/2 cubits in front of Jupiter, 1 1/2 cubits in front of ζ Tauri. Night of the 15th, middle part of the night, [...] ... last part of the night, [...]
[...] mustard, 1 kur 2 pānu 3 sūtu; cress, 1 pānu 5 sūtu [...]
[...] ... entered the cypress? garden [...]
[...] ... At that time, Jupiter was in Gemini, at the end of the month, in Taurus; [...]
[...] (blank)

[Month IX, the 1st (of which followed the 30th of the preceding month) ... Night of the 2nd, the moon was nn] cubits [in front of β Capricorni,] 2 cubits in front of Saturn. Night of the 3rd, the moon was 3 cubits in front of γ Capricorni [...]
[...] thunder; last part of the night, Mercury was 2 cubits above α Scorpii, Mercury being 8 fingers back to the west [...]
[... Night of the 9th, beginn]ing of the night, the moon was 1 cubit behind α Arietis. Night of the 10th, beginning of the night, [...]
[... Night of the 12th, beginning of the night, the moon was nn] cubits [... ζ Tauri, 1 1/2 cubits behind Jupiter. The 12th, moonset to sunrise: 8°. Night of the 13th, beginning [of the night, ...]
[...] ... overcast, dew. Night of the 15th, very overcast. Night of the 10+[xth, ...]
[...] 2 1/2 cubits, the moon having passed 1 cubit to the east. Night of the 20+[x]th, last part of the night, the moon was behind [...]
[...] The 24th, clouds were in the sky. Night of the 25th, last part of the night, the moon was 1 2/3 cubits behind α Scorpii. Night [...]
[...] That month, the equivalent (for 1 shekel of silver was): barley, 1 kur 2 pānu 3 sūtu; dates, 3 pānu 2 sūtu; mustard, 2 kur; cress, [...]
[...] That month, the Babylonians ... of Babylon? of the crown of Bēl (and) Nabû ... [...]
[...] had carried off, were burnt in the district of Tintir ... [...]
[...] (blank)
[Month X, ...] rain shower. The 2nd, Venus’ first appearance in the west in Capricorn; sunset to setting of Venus: 11°?; (ideal) first appearance around the 28th ... [...]
[...] beginning of the night, the m[oon ...] ... [...]
[... month V]II to the end of month XII₂, year 34, Antiochus [...]
[...] from month VII to the end of month XII₂, year 34, kings Antiochus and Seleucus.
[...] year 34, kings Antiochus and Seleucus.
[Diar]y from month I to the end of month VII of year 34, kings [Anti]ochus and Seleucus.
Diary from month I [to the end of month VII, year 34 ...]
[...] kings Antiochus and Seleucus.
[...] kings [Antiochus and] Seleucus.
